results.title: Listen to me
results.creator_credit: Terrence Doran and Police and Community Video Project
results.brief_description: This kit is a useful new education resource designed to address social factors that undermine the formation of a healthy and respectful relationship between the police force and young people. It is a joint production of local police, young people and community from the inner urban area of Flemington/Kensington in Melbourne. The kit consists of a video and a set of linked, but autonomous education modules. The video is a realist documentary style production that aims to give a ‘slice of life’ view of a neighbourhood and its young people; police work in the neighbourhood; and situations of conflict of distrust that arise between young people and the police. The themes underpinning the video are picked up and expanded in the five specific education modules which include: young people, conflict and the police; high-rise living and the police; communication, cultural diversity and policing; young women and the police; the role of the police.

results.title: Listen to Britain
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Jennings and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: The sights and sounds of a people at war, told without commentary or dialogue - the roar of tanks and planes, the voices of children, the multi lingual radio commentators, Commonwealth soldiers, Flanagan and Allen singing “Underneath the Arches”, Myra Hess playing a Mozart concerto, a military brass band counterpointed with genius and affection to scenes in streets and factories and country places. This film is considered one of the most successful of the documentary films of Humphrey Jennings.

results.title: Listen please
results.creator_credit: Modern Management Films and Calvin Productions
results.brief_description: Supervisors learn the value of listening. It boosts their employees’ morale, keeps grievances to a minimum and assists in decision making. The obstacles to listening, such as being too preoccupied or busy must be recognised and overcome.

results.title: Listen hear
results.brief_description: Effective listening is a skill. This video program identifies and explains how we can improve our listening and highlights the four main listening techniques: listening with your whole body; rapport building; responding appropriately; removing barriers. The program is aimed at trainers/facilitators within organizations and includes a Trainer’s Manual.

results.title: Lismer
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film looks at the work of Arthur Lismer, a member of the Group of Seven, emphasizing his contribution to art education and to Canadian art. At the Montreal Art Centre we see how children learn the independence of creative self-expression in art.

results.title: Lisa makes the headlines
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
Lisa’s newspaper isn’t selling very well. When Ida, one of her friends is robbed, Lisa thinks she is onto a scoop. However she comes to realise that she has to get her facts straight before she can write a good story. From the television series.

results.title: Lisa Curry's pregnancy workout
results.creator_credit: Jeff Hogan, Leigh Gower and Carol Lloyd Corporate Theatre
results.brief_description: The golden girl of Australian swimming, Lisa Curry presents this personal pregnancy workout program - a professionally planned and directed series of aerobic-styled exercises you can do each day in the privacy of your own home. Filmed in the Sunshine Coast waterfront home Lisa shares with husband, Grant Kenny - surfing “iron man” and Olympic canoeist -“Lisa Curry’s pregnancy workout” covers a wide range of pregnancy health and fitness topics of assistance to all expectant parents.

results.title: Liquids can burn
results.brief_description: Uses demonstrations and laboratory experiments to show the flammability of various liquids found in the home. The film lists these seemingly harmless liquids - petrol, turpentine, paint-thinner, kerosene, solvents, charcoal and cigarette-lighter fluid and shows the potential perils.

results.title: Liquid Wind
results.creator_credit: Holly North, Peter Hellman and Greg Battye
results.brief_description: Liquid Wind takes learners from the very basics of sensing wind direction, rigging the board, sailing theory and techniques, and safety, to sailing in stronger winds and using a harness. The instruction is compatible with the ACABSI Elementary I syllabus.

results.title: Liquid Sun (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Sydney University Television Services and Apace Research
results.brief_description: The production of power alcohol from farm crops, and its uses as motor fuel is causing great interest in Australia. It is a major challenge facing primary producers and could be an economic proposition in many areas
